Name: Scikit-learn
Description: Foundational Python library for traditional machine learning algorithms (classification, regression, clustering, etc.).
Recommendation relevance: Essential library/tool (R8) providing standard ML algorithm implementations (support R3).

Name: spaCy
Description: Popular Python library for advanced Natural Language Processing tasks (NER, POS tagging, dependency parsing).

Name: NLTK (Natural Language Toolkit)
Description: Foundational Python library providing tools and corpora for NLP research and development.

Name: Transformers (Hugging Face)
Description: Core Hugging Face library providing access to thousands of pre-trained transformer models for NLP, CV, and audio.
Recommendation relevance: Core library (R8) providing access to pre-trained models (R2).

Name: PyTorch Lightning
Description: High-level interface for PyTorch, organizing code and simplifying boilerplate for training deep learning models.
Recommendation relevance: Library/tool (R8) simplifying PyTorch code structure, aiding reproducibility (R3).

Name: Fastai
Description: High-level deep learning library built on PyTorch, emphasizing ease of use and practical application.
Recommendation relevance: Library/tool (R8) implementing best practices (R5) for easier DL application.

Name: XGBoost
Description: Optimized distributed gradient boosting library designed for speed and performance.
Recommendation relevance: Library/tool (R8) providing efficient gradient boosting implementation (R7).

Name: LightGBM
Description: Gradient boosting framework by Microsoft known for its speed and efficiency, especially with large datasets.
Recommendation relevance: Library/tool (R8) providing efficient gradient boosting implementation (R7).

Name: Dask
Description: Flexible library for parallel computing in Python, often used for scaling Pandas, Numpy, and Scikit-learn.
Recommendation relevance: Library/tool (R8) for parallel computing, scaling analysis of large data (R1, R7).

Name: Replicate
Description: Platform for running ML models via APIs, hosting a large collection of discoverable models (especially generative).
Recommendation relevance: Platform (R8) for running and discovering models (R2).
